name: Search Terms
description: Enter your search queries here. For example search queries, refer to [https://github.com/igorbrigadir/twitter-advanced-search](https://github.com/igorbrigadir/twitter-advanced-search).

name: Max Tweets Per Query/Profile/URL
description: Set the maximum number of tweets to scrape per query, profile, or URL. For instance, if you set a maximum of 50 for 3 search terms, the total tweet limit will be 150.

name: Overall Maximum Tweets
description: Set an overall limit for the number of tweets to scrape across all threads. Once this limit is reached, all threads will stop. This may lead to unequal numbers of tweets collected from each query. To ensure equal distribution, consider using the 'Max Tweets Per Input' setting.

name: Tweet Language
description: Choose a specific language to filter tweets. If left as 'Any', tweets in all languages will be included. Options: "any", "en", "es", "zh", "am", "ar", "bg", "bn", "bo", "ca", "ch", "cs", "da", "de", "dv", "el", "et", "fa", "fi", "fr", "gu", "hi", "ht", "hu", "hy", "in", "is", "it", "iu", "iw", "ja", "ka", "km", "kn", "ko", "lo", "lt", "lv", "ml", "my", "ne", "nl", "no", "or", "pa", "pl", "pt", "ro", "ru", "si", "sk", "sl", "sv", "ta", "te", "th", "tl", "tr", "uk", "ur", "vi"

name: Specific Twitter Profiles
description: Provide a list of Twitter profiles to scrape. The profiles should be written as 'username' or '@username'

name: Use Experimental Profile Scraper
description: Activates an experimental profile scraper that uses the user timeline instead of search and should have a few months of history (can go back a few months rather than 10 days) but doesn't work with filtering, except tweet only will only return the user's tweets and replies.

name: Specific Tweet URLs
description: List the twitter search URLs you want to scape such as '[https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1656898688739057665](https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1656898688739057665)' if your url contains more such as a cursor like '[https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1656898688739057665?s=20](https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1656898688739057665?s=20)' only the tweets on the current screen will be loaded.

name: Info to collect
description: Options to either collect each tweet with all of its replies, only each tweet, or only the replies. Options: "user info and replying info", "only replying info", "only user info"

name: Twitter Search URLs
description: List the full links to tweets you want to scape such as '[https://twitter.com/search?q=((MadMaxFuryRoad%20OR%20MadMax%20OR%20%22FuryRoad%22%20OR%20%22GeorgeMiller%22%20OR%20GeorgeMiller%20OR%20TomHardy%20OR%20%22CharlizeTheron%22%20OR%20CharlizeTheron)%20AND%20(Film%20OR%20Movie%20OR%20Review))&src=typed_query&f=top](https://twitter.com/search?q=((MadMaxFuryRoad%20OR%20MadMax%20OR%20%22FuryRoad%22%20OR%20%22GeorgeMiller%22%20OR%20GeorgeMiller%20OR%20TomHardy%20OR%20%22CharlizeTheron%22%20OR%20CharlizeTheron)%20AND%20(Film%20OR%20Movie%20OR%20Review))&src=typed_query&f=top)' if your url contains more such as a cursor only the tweets on the current screen will be loaded.

name: Only tweets (no retweets, replies or quotes)
description: Filters content to only return tweets that are not retweets, replies, or quotes.

name: Only verified users
description: Filters content to only return tweets from verified users

name: Only verified users with Twitter Blue
description: Filters content to only return tweets from verified users with Twitter Blue

name: Only retweets made using the retweet button
description: Only retweets created using the retweet button. Works well combined with from: to show only retweets. Only works within the last 7-10 days or so.

name: Only retweets or quoted tweets
description: Old style retweets ('RT') + quoted tweets

name: Only replies
description: Returns tweets that are a reply to another Tweet

name: Contain Quote Tweets
description: Filters content to only return Quote Tweets

name: Has some engagement
description: Has some engagement (replies, favorites, retweets). Can be negated to find tweets with no engagement.

name: All media types
description: Filters content to only return tweets with any media type

name: All images
description: Filters content to only return tweets with any image

name: All video types
description: Filters content to only return tweets with any video type, including native Twitter video and external sources such as Youtube.

name: Native Twitter images
description: Filters content to only return tweets with native Twitter images (pic.twitter.com links)

name: Only safe tweets
description: Filters out unsafe tweets

name: Author
description: Written by a particular user. Useful if you want to use multiple custom queries for a single user.

name: In reply to
description: Geotagged in this place. Also supports Phrases, eg: near:'The Hague'

name: Mentioning
description: Geotagged in this place. Also supports Phrases, eg: near:'The Hague'

name: Geotagged near
description: Geotagged in this place. Also supports Phrases, eg: near:'The Hague'

name: Within Radius
description: Within specific radius of the 'near' operator, to apply a limit. Can use km or mi. e.g. fire near:san-francisco within:10km

name: Geocode
description: To get tweets around a specific location, use geocode:lat,long,radius. E.g., to get tweets 10km around twitters hq, use geocode:37.7764685,-122.4172004,10km

name: Place Object ID
description: Search tweets by Place Object ID eg: USA Place ID is 96683cc9126741d1

name: Minimum Retweets
description: Specify minimum number of Retweets a tweet should have to be included.

name: Minimum Favorites
description: Specify minimum number of favorites a tweet should have to be included.

name: Minimum Replies
description: Specify minimum number of replies a tweet should have to be included.

name: Start
description: Specify the earliest date (inclusive) from which to start scraping tweets. The date should be in the 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

name: End
description: Specify the latest date (exclusive) until which to scrape tweets. The date should be in the 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

name: Maximum Attempts
description: Specify the maximum number of attempts to be made if a scrape operation fails. After reaching this limit, the failed operation will be skipped.

name: Manually Set Number of Threads/Workers (if blank it will automatically optimize based on memory)
description: Overrides the number of threads/workers automatically optimized for your memory amount. Could be useful for troubleshooting.
